Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit another first-inning home run
Anthony Volpe hit a third-inning grand slam
Gleyber Torres added a homer for the Yankees
Alex Verdugo hit an RBI grounder in the second
Austin Wells hit a second-deck homer in the sixth
Torres hit a three-run homer off Brent Honeywell in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in the first four games of a World Series and his streak of long balls in six straight games is one more than Houstonâ€™s George Springer 2017 and '19
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said, 'The place was shaking. I felt the ground literally shaking'
Aaron Judge said, 'All it takes is just one swing'
Aaron Judge described the mood as, 'Why not go out tomorrow and have fun?'
Dave Roberts said, 'They're going to fight. If you made it this far, you have a resilient team that's going to fight the whole time.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Volpe, a New York native, hit a grand slam and stole two bases in one game
The Yankees avoided what would have been their first losing Series sweep since 1976
The game was played at Yankee Stadium with a sellout crowd of 49,354
